Indiana lawmakers are making it a priority to attack women’s reproductive rights.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

The attacks are back. Every legislative session, Indiana lawmakers make it a priority to attack women’s reproductive rights. Let’s send them a clear message: We won’t go back.

Two anti-reproductive rights bills, HB 1211 and SB 201, are quickly making their way through the House and Senate. We must act now to protect a woman’s right to make personal decisions about her reproductive health without shame or interference from the government.

HB 1211 attempts to ban one of the most common forms of abortion, dilation and evacuation, undermining doctors’ professional recommendations and pushing reproductive rights out of reach.

SB 201 favors the right to a religious objection at the cost of a woman’s right to reproductive care. This bill, or existing law, doesn’t include an emergency exception to similarly protect the right of a woman to receive reproductive care.

Both bills are an enormous a step toward dismantling reproductive rights nationwide. We must act now. Contact your House representative to oppose HB 1211 and your State senator to oppose SB 201.

Thanks for sticking with us,

ACLU of Indiana
